CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 11;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is the chairman of the association “ ORG , ORG for GPE ” ( „ Гражданско общество за български интереси , национално достойнство , единение и обединение – за GPE “ – “ the association ” ) .
CARDINAL . The association was founded on DATE in GPE . At a meeting on that date the founders adopted its articles and elected its management bodies . The applicant was elected as its chairman .
CARDINAL . The association 's articles read , as relevant :
“ CARDINAL . [ The association ] is a NORP patriotic nonprofit organisation . It shall be DEMOCRATIC in form and ORG in content .

OBJECT : mass , historically and morally enlightening , societal and political , cultural and educational , scientific and research , sport and technical , publishing , advertising , charitable and all other types of activities and services which are allowed ( not prohibited ) under the [ Persons and Family Act of DATE ] in respect of nonprofit associations .

CARDINAL . NORP [ The association ] is founded with the aims of : uplifting the NORP spirit ; protecting the NORP interests and creating a wealthy , prosperous and patriotic nation ; elevating , developing and preserving the NORP national dignity ; uniting the NORP identity within and outside the boundaries of the promised NORP land , under the flag of historical truth ; protecting and restoring the coat of arms of GPE as a coat of arms of GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP [ The association ] is for the creation of a people 's court to judge those responsible for the gravest economic , spiritual , moral and demographic crisis of the NORP society , NORP banking and NORP statehood since CARDINAL September CARDINAL , in particular the period DATE and DATE . ...

CARDINAL . NORP [ The association ] is for a wide discussion ... of the illegal trampling and repealing of our first constitution after our liberation in DATE , the most democratic LAW of PERSON and the imposition of the present [ LAW ] ...
[ The association ] is for the reinstatement ( possibly with amendments ) of the unlawfully abolished ' ORG OF ORG ' ...
[ The association ] is for ... changing the form of government of GPE , for the returning of PERSON to the motherland and the throne . ...

CARDINAL . NORP ... The core of the [ association 's ] activity shall be the spiritual unification of all NORP , contacts with and consolidation of ORG , establishment of sincere relations with ... all NORP outside GPE , and , in the international relations – point CARDINAL shall be : abolition ( opening ) of the border between GPE and GPE ... ”
CARDINAL . On an unspecified later date the association submitted to ORG an application for registration .
CARDINAL . ORG refused the application in a judgment of DATE . It held :

“ [ According to ] clause CARDINAL of [ its articles ] , [ the association ] intends to protect and restore the coat of arms of GPE as a coat of arms of GPE . According to clause CARDINAL of the articles , the association is for the establishment of a ' people 's court to judge those responsible for the gravest economic , spiritual , moral and demographic crisis of the NORP society , NORP banking and NORP statehood since DATE , in particular DATE and DATE . Clause CARDINAL of the articles provides for a debate on the repealing of the LAW of PERSON and the adoption of the [ C]onstitution [ of DATE ] which is presently in force .

The goals which have been enumerated thus far are sufficient to refuse the association 's registration . They are clearly political in nature and are characteristic of a political party , whose registration is to be carried out under LAW [ of DATE ] . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant , acting in his capacity of chairman of the association , appealed to ORG . He argued , inter alia , that the association 's aims were not political , but goals which could be pursued by every citizen .

CARDINAL . Following an amendment to LAW providing that the judgments of the regional courts were no longer appealable before ORG , but before the newly established courts of appeals , on DATE ORG forwarded the applicant 's appeal to the newly created ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the lower court 's judgment . It held as follows :

“ The articles of [ the association ] contain provisions which are contrary to LAW of GPE . For instance , clause CARDINAL of the articles provides for the restoration of the coat of arms of GPE as the country 's coat of arms . Clause CARDINAL provides for a change of the form of government from republic to monarchy and for the restoration of the LAW of Tarnovo [ of DATE ] . Clause CARDINAL of the articles – abolition of the border between GPE and [ the former GPE of ] GPE . These goals , as formulated in the above - cited clauses , run counter to ORG , CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW . Moreover , the association indeed has political goals , whereas by LAW associations may not pursue political goals and carry out political activities that are characteristic solely of political parties . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed on points of law to ORG . He argued that the lower court had incorrectly held that the association 's aims were contrary to LAW . Furthermore , the association did not pursue political aims , because it was not aspiring to accede to power . The courts ' refusal to register it was an infringement of its founders ' freedom of expression .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG directed the applicant to specify the grounds on which he sought the quashing of the judgment below . In line with these instructions , the applicant submitted additional observations . He reiterated his contention that the association 's aims were not political , because it was not seeking to accede to power through elections or otherwise , or exercise it . Its aims were characteristic of the civil society and were to be achieved through other , nonpolitical means . Furthermore , the association 's articles did not provide for the creation of a people 's court , it did not in fact object to the new coat of arms of GPE and was not seeking to change the form of government from republic to monarchy . These were erroneous findings of the lower court . Finally , the association was seeking to achieve the spiritual union of all NORP , not the abolition of the border between GPE and the former GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment in the following terms :

“ The [ lower court ] correctly found that the goals set out in clauses CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE of the association 's articles have a certain political tenor and are characteristic of a political party , whose registration is to be carried out under LAW [ of DATE ] . These goals are contrary to ORG , CARDINAL § CARDINAL and QUANTITY [ of the LAW of DATE ] . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW of DATE read as follows :
“ GPE is a republic with a parliamentary form of government . ”
“ The territorial integrity of GPE shall be inviolable . ”

CARDINAL . NORP Parties shall facilitate the formation of the citizens ' political will . The manner of forming and dissolving political parties , as well as the conditions pertaining to their activity , shall be established by law .
CARDINAL . No political parties shall be formed on ethnic , racial , or religious basis , nor parties which seek to accede to power by force . ”
“ CARDINAL . NORP The citizens ' associations shall serve to further and safeguard their interests .
CARDINAL . Associations ... may not pursue political goals or carry out political activities that are characteristic solely of political parties . ”
“ CARDINAL . Citizens may freely associate .

CARDINAL . Organisations whose activity is directed against the sovereignty [ or ] the territorial integrity of the country and the unity of the nation , towards the incitement of racial , national , ethnical or religious enmity ... as well as organisations which seek to achieve their goals through violence are prohibited .
CARDINAL . The law shall specify the organisations which are subject to registration , the manner of their dissolution , as well as their relations with the ORG . ”
“ The Coat of Arms of the Republic of Bulgaria shall depict a gold lion rampant on a dark gules shield . ”

CARDINAL . At the material time this LAW ( „ Закон за лицата и семейството “ ) , the relevant provisions of which were superseded by new legislation in DATE , regulated the formation , status and dissolution of nonprofit legal entities , i.e. associations and foundations . Its pertinent provisions were :
“ An association shall acquire legal personality after its entry in the register [ kept by ] ORG . ”

“ An association shall be registered pursuant to an application by [ its ] management committee [ to which shall be enclosed ] a resolution for its founding and its articles of association , signed by the founders ... ”
“ Associations shall be managed in accordance with [ their ] articles of association , which must contain provisions in respect of [ their ] name , aims , means ... ”

CARDINAL . At the material time this LAW ( „ Закон за политическите партии “ ) , which was superseded by new legislation in DATE , regulated the formation , registration , functioning and dissolution of political parties . Its relevant provisions read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . Citizens may freely associate in political parties to influence the formation and expression of the political will of the people through elections or other democratic means .
CARDINAL . Other organisations and movements may also carry out political activities within the bounds set by the LAW and the laws . ”
“ A political party may be formed [ by ] not CARDINAL enfranchised citizens . ”
“ CARDINAL . A public organisation which has not been registered as a political party may not carry out the activity of a political party .

CARDINAL . A [ public organisation ] which has not been registered as a political party may not carry out organised political activities [ on the LOC of ] enterprises , government agencies and organisations .

CARDINAL . ' Organised political activities ' shall mean the holding of meetings , demonstrations , assemblies and other forms of campaigning in favour of or against a political party or an election candidate .

CARDINAL . NORP If a public organisation ... clearly carries out the activity of a political party , the regional prosecutor shall propose that it be dissolved or [ re]register as a political party within DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG If the organisation under the foregoing subsection does not cease its political activity or [ re]register as a political party , it shall be dissolved ... ”

CARDINAL . The LAW also regulated the manner in which political parties were financed , providing for certain upper limits on the donations that they could receive and prohibiting their receiving anonymous donations and donations from foreign states and organisations ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP Only political parties ( and coalitions of such parties ) , and not associations , may participate in parliamentary , presidential , local and NORP elections and nominate candidates ( section CARDINAL ) , ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the Electing of Members of ORG of DATE ( „ Закон за избиране на народни представители , общински съветници и кметове “ ) , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Electing of Members of Parliament Act of DATE ( „ Закон за избиране на народни представители “ ) , section CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the Electing of a President and a ORG of GPE of DATE ( „ Закон за избиране на президент и вицепрезидент на републиката “ ) , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE ( „ Закон за местните избори “ ) , and section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the Electing of Members of ORG from GPE of DATE ( „ Закон за избиране на членове на Европейския парламент от ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ( реш. № CARDINAL от CARDINAL април DATE г. по PERSON № DATE г. , обн. , GPE , бр. CARDINAL от CARDINAL април DATE г. ) ORG stated , inter alia , that “ political activities that are characteristic solely of political parties ” , within the meaning of LAW of DATE , were defined by LAW thereof as those which facilitate “ the formation of the citizens ' political will ” through “ elections or other democratic means ” , as specified by LAW of DATE . The court also stated that “ what was essential for this type of political activity [ was ] the direct participation in the process of forming the bodies through which , according to LAW , the people exercise[d ] its power ” . Of course , the activities of a party in connection with upcoming elections embraced the holding of meetings , assemblies and other forms of public campaigning in support of the party and the candidates nominated by it , which were also activities aimed at “ forming ” the citizens ' political will .

CARDINAL . The LAW of DATE was the first written constitution of GPE , adopted by ORG on DATE , shortly after the creation of GPE as an independent ORG in DATE . It was repealed in DATE . It provided for constitutional monarchy ( Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE ) , with a directly elected parliament and universal suffrage ( Article DATE ) , a government accountable to the parliament ( LAW , and separation of powers ( Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE ) . It prohibited torture ( LAW ) and punishment without law and due process ( LAW and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) , enshrined the right to property ( Articles CARDINAL and DATE ) , the right to respect for one 's home and correspondence ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) , and the freedoms of the press and of assembly and association ( Articles CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE ) .
